record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, APRIL 11, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, April 11; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume debate concurrently on S. 5 and S. 30, as provided for under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
